metadata.title: CVE-2015-7194 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer underflow in libjar in Mozilla Firefox before 42.0 and Firefox ESR38.x before 38.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted ZIParchive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
